newsitem.title: UK: FTSE 100 opens lower after U.S. attack on Iraq.
newsitem.headline: FTSE 100 opens lower after U.S. attack on Iraq.

text.p: UK shares opened weaker on Tuesday, nervously eyeing events in Iraq after the U.S. said it had launched missile attacks.
"It's going to be a very twitchy market this morning," said one senior dealer. "All eyes are on Iraq."
The FTSE 100 index was down 16.4 points at 3,868.0 by 0754 GMT, despite a mark-up in the shares of major oil companies.
Traders said the mood was jittery as they watch for events in the Gulf to unfold. Almost all of yesterday's 16.8 gain was wiped out when the market reopened.
